questions.question: 1. Mato's scores on tbe first 4 tests in his chemistry class were 85, 98, 92, and 77. How many points must Mato score on a fifth test to average exactly 90 points for these 5 equally weighted tests?
2. A point at (-3, 7) in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane is shifted down 3 units and right 7 units. What are the coordinates of the new point?

3. A warehouse dispatcher is responsible for the immediate delivery of 75,000 condensers. She can use only 2 different sizes of trucks for the task. Each of the larger trucks will carry a maximum of 15,000 condensers. Each of the smaller trucks will carry a maximum of 12,000 condensers. The dispatcher has 2 of the larger trucks to use. If each truck makes only a single trip, how many of the smaller trucks must be used with the 2 larger size trucks to deliver this order?

choices.E: Cannot be determined from the given information

questions.question: 4. Brian bought a pair of jeans for  of the original price of $48.00 and a belt for 40% of its original price of ＄12.50. Ignoring sales tax, what is the total amount of these purchases?
5.  In isosceles triangle △RET, ∠E and ∠T are congruent and the measure of ∠R is 94°. What is the measure of ∠E?
6. The largest square in the figure below is partitioned into 36 congruent smaller squares. What fraction of the interior of the largest square is black？
7. When x = -1 and y = 3, what is the value of 4x2 - 3xy?
8. Which of the following is a value for x that solves the equation | x - 2 | = 5 ?
9. In the figure below, AW and are perpendicular at X and bisect each other. The measure of ∠WYX is 58°. What is the measure of ∠BAX?

choices.E: Cannot be determined from the given information

questions.question: 10. Ms. Juarez announced the grade distribution for the last book report. Of the 24 students in the class, 8 earned A's, 10 earned B's, and 6 earned C's. When a student is picked at random to be the first to present his or her book report to the class, what is the probability that the student picked had earned an A on the book report?

11. A man started a 280-mile drive with a full tank of gas in his car. At the end of the trip he spent $23.40 to refill his car's tank with 18 gallons of gasoline selling for $1.30 per gallon. Which of the following is an expression for the number of miles per gallon the car averaged?

12. Jim bought 3 large decals and 2 small decals of a school logo for $1.30. When he went home his sister asked him the price of a small decal: He remembered that each large decal costs $.10 more than each small decal. How much did 1 small decal cost?
13. For what value of k is x = 2 a solution of x2 - 8x + k = 0 ?
14. One side of square ABCD is 12 meters long. A rectangle with the same area as square ABCD bas a length of 9 meters. What is the rectangle's width, in meters?
15. In polygon ABCDE shown below, the angles at A, B, and E are right angles. What is the perimeter of the polygon, in feet?
16. The figure below shows 3 circles in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane. Which of the following shows the reflection of the 3 circles across the x-axis?
17. What is the slope of any line parallel to the line 6x + 5y = 7 ?
18. Which of the following is a possible definition for f(x) if f(2) = 5 ?

19.  A formula for the volume, V, of a right circular cylinder in terms of its radius, r, and its height, h, is V = πr2h. What is the height, in centimeters, of a right circular cylinder that has a volume of 270π cubic centimeters and a radius of 3 centimeters?

20. Gerry is building a dollhouse that is to bo a scale model of a house that is 36 feet high, 84 feet long, and 48 feet wide. What should be the dimensions, in feet, of the dollhouse Gerry is building if tho scale of the model to the house is 1:12 ?          Height         Length            Width

21. The manager of a grocery store asks Kamar to construct a display consisting of 10 rows of cans stacked on top of each other. The manager wants the bottom row to have 25 cans and each succeeding row to have I less can than the row below it. Part of 3 rows of the display is shown in the figure below. How many cans will be in the top row of the display?

22. One pair of corresponding sides of 2 similar triangles are 3 and 8 inches long, respectively. If the perimeter of the smaller triangle is 12 inches, what is the perimeter, in inches, of the larger triangle?
23. The equation shown below is true for what value of x ?3(x - 5) - 2(x - 4) = 8x

24. Each of the 4 sides of the "IN" tray in an office has the shape of a trapezoid, as shown below.The length of the bottom of each side is  inches and the length of the top of each side is 11 inches. What is the length, in inches, of the median of each trapezoid?

25. In Abraham Lincoln's 1863 Gettysburg Address, he refers to the year 1776 as "4 score and 7 years ago." Which of the following equations, when solved for s, gives the number of years a score refers to?
26. What is the sum of the 2 solutions of the equation x2 + x - 6 = 0 ?

27. For an assignment on symmetry, Crystal created the pattern of digits shown below. Her teacher commented on the symmetry when evaluating the assignment. Which of the following is a true comment about the symmetry of this pattern?

choices.A: The pattern has only a horizontal line of symmetry.
choices.B: The pattern has both a horizontal line and a vertical line of symmetry.
choices.C: The pattern has only a vertical line of symmetry.
choices.D: The pattern has a rotational symmetry of 180°.
choices.E: The pattern has a rotational symmetry of 90°.

questions.question: 28. The ratio of a to b is 3 to 1, and the ratio of b to c is 1 to 5. What is the value of ?

29. Becky has 76 solid-colored disks that are either red, blue, or green. She lines them up on the floor and finds that there are 4 more red disks than green and 6 more green disks than blue. How many red disks does she have?
30. The probability that a specific event, E, happens is denoted P(E) . The probability that this event does not happen is denoted P(not E). Which of the following statements is always true?
31. Which of the following expressions is equivalent to , where a is a real number?
32. Which of the following is equivalent to (y + 5)3 ?

33. In the right triangle shown below, a leg is 2 meters long and its adjacent acute angle measures 53°. About how many meters long is the hypotenuse?(Note: sin 53° ≈ 0.80  cos 53°≈ 0.60  tan 53°= 1.33)

34. Boaters use 5 small flags of different colors to send messages to people in other boats. All 5 flags are flown on 1 pole, and the messages are conveyed by the order of the flags from the top of the pole downward. In how many different orders can the 5 flags be flown?
35. What is the least common multiple of the numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 ?

36. As shown below, gears p and q mesh smoothly so that they turn simultaneously with each other. Each gear rotates about its fixed center. If gear p has 17 teeth and gear q has 51 teeth, how many revolutions will gear q make if gear p makes 15 revolutions ?

37. A small electric fan, shown below, has 3 blades. The angle between each 2 blades is 120°, and the tip of each blade is 5 inches from the center of the fan, as shown. To the nearest 0.1 inch, how many inches apart are the tips of 2 blades?

38. The function f shown in the graph below represents the projection of yearly profits for the Rip It Up toy company. The actual profits are represented by the graph of the function g. Which of the following descriptions is the most accurate explanation for the variation between the graph of g and the graph of f ?

choices.A: The yearly profits were only  as large as projected.
choices.B: The yearly profits were consistently $10,000 less than projected.
choices.C: The yearly profits were greater than prejected.
choices.D: The 2 graphs show no difference in the yearly profits.
choices.E: The yearly profits started to decline after several years and continued to decline through the 6th year.

questions.question: 39. To prepare 8 boxes of books for shipping, LaRonda will put 2 strips of strapping tape around each box, as shown below. Each strip of tape goes all the way around the box, and the strips of tape meet at right angles on the top and bottom of the box. Each box is 24 inches long, 18 inches wide, and 20 inches high. What is the minimum number of inches of strapping tape LaRonda will need to prepare all 8 boxes for shipping?
40. The interior angle measures of a triangle are in the ratio 3:8:9. What is the measure of this triangle's largest interior angle?
41. The graph of  has an x-intercept at which of the following points?

42. Use the following information to answer questions 42-44.Consider the rational function f(x) = , whose graph is shown in the standard (x, y)coordinate plane below. What is the value of f(x) at x = 4 ?

43. Use the following information to answer questions 42-44.Consider the rational function f(x) = , whose graph is shown in the standard (x, y)coordinate plane below.What is the domain of f(x)?(Note: The domain of a function is all the x-values for which the function is defined.)

choices.A: All real values of x except +3
choices.B: All real values of x except
choices.C: All real values of x except 7
choices.D: All real values of x except +3 and 7
choices.E: All real values of x where x ≤ -6 or x ≥ 8

questions.question: 44. Use the following information to answer questions 42-44.Consider the rational function f(x) = , whose graph is shown in the standard (x, y)coordinate plane below.How many horizontal and/or vertical asymptotes are there for the graph of f(x) ?

45. The area of a rectangular piece of poster board is 220 square inches. A rectangular photograph that is twice as tall as it is wide is glued to the poster board so that the poster board extends 3 inches beyond the photograph on the top and bottom and 2 inches beyond the photograph on the left and right sides, as shown below. How many inches wide is the photograph?
46. A circle with a diameter of 8 inches is inscribed in square ABCD, as shown below. What is the area, in square inches, of the shaded region?
47. The side lengths of △XYZ, shown in the figure below, are in centimeters. One of the 5 points A-E is the center of the circle that goes through points X, Y, and Z. Which point is the center?

48. Sven obtained the weight, y pounds, and shoe size, x, of 25 randomly selected male students at his school. He determined that the line best fitting his data was given by the equation y = . He used this line fo predict the weight of a new male student who wears size shoes. Compared to this student's actual weight of 165 pounds, the prediction of his weight from Sven's line was:

choices.A: too high by less than 1 pound.
choices.B: too high by more than 1 pound.
choices.C: too low by less than 1 pound.
choices.E: too low by more than 1 pound.

questions.question: 49. Shown in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane below, the graph of x2 + y2 = 1 is restricted by one of the following conditions. Which one?

50. The triangle shown in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane below has vertices as marked. If each coordinate of each vertex is multiplied by 4, what will be the area, in square coordinate units, of the triangle with the resulting points as its vertices?
51. A circle with center (-1, -4)is shown in the standard(x, y) coordinate plane below. Which of the following is an equation of the line that is tangent to the circle at the point (0, -2) ?
52. The right rectangular prism shown below has a base that is 4 meters by 6 meters and a volume of 240 cubic meters. What is the total surface area, in square meters, of all 6 faces of the prism?

choices.E: Cannot be determined from the given information

55. Consider the functions  f(x) = | x |  and  g(x) = -x2 + a . One of the following graphs is the graph of y = f(g(x)) in the standard (x,y) coordinate plane, for some a > 0. Which graph is it?
56. Which of the following has a greater value than all the others for all values of x in the interval 0 < x < 1 ?
57. For positive real numbers a, b, and c such that , which of the following is true ?

58. The figure below shows the path of a certain projectile launched from the ground at an angle of θ. The horizontal range, r, of this projectile when launched from the ground at a speed of 20 meters per second is modeled by r = 40 sin (2θ) .For this model, the angle measure θ that results in the greatest horizontal range, r, is 45° because:

choices.A: 2 sin θ is greater than sin θ.
choices.B: sin 90° is as large as sine can get.
choices.C: sin 45° is as large as sine can get.
choices.E: sin 2θ is greater than sin θ.

questions.question: 59. The vertex of ∠A is the origin of the standard (x, y) coordinate plane shown below. One ray of ∠A is the positive x-axis. The other ray, AB, is positioned so that sin A < 0 and cos A > 0. In which quadrant, if it can be determined, is point B ?

choices.E: Cannot be determined from the given information

questions.question: 60. In the figure below, a ladder on level ground rests against the side of a building. The ladder reaches a point on the building that is 20 feet above ground. The angle formed by the ladder and the ground is 65°. A point on the ladder is 4 feet from the wall What is the vertical distance x, in feet, from this point on the ladder to the ground?
